intro: Trigonostemon wildeorum, commonly known as the Wilde's trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes numerous species with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, often in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
